content.question:
Which of the following definite integrals are equal to <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, the sine of, open parenthesis, negative 1, plus, the fraction 5 k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 5 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?
<math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 4, of, sine x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 5, of, the sine of, open parenthesis, negative 1, plus x, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
<math alttext="5 times the integral from, 0 to 1, of, the sine of, open parenthesis, negative 1, plus 5 x, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
